Description: Papyrus (five fragments: one substantial; four tiny). Demotic account recto and verso. The main fragment is torn on both sides and at the top and bottom, but the top margin may be preserved. On the recto two columns. Column A: 16 lines of text; the beginning of lines 6-16 are damaged and lines 12-16 are very faded. Of column B only the opening signs of six lines of text are preserved. On the verso there are the beginnings of seven lines of text.
Curator's comments: The text on the recto lists deliveries/payments made by various people (male and female). In column B there is the beginning of date (month only) and mention of 'the ibises'. The text on the verso begins with '4th month of inundation'.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (380964) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/380964)
